entry.title: Vitaly Potyarkin / 2022-11-07 11:15
entry.content:
Recently I've started to prefer Golang over Python for my hobby projects.

Easy to distribute binaries and easy concurrency have outweighed initial superfluous rejection over use of tabs for indentation and "err != nil" everywhere.

Also, golang dependency ecosystem at least gives me some hope that years down the line some old project of mine will remain buildable. Of course, this may turn out to be just a beginner's illusion :-)

entry.title: Vitaly Potyarkin / 2022-08-28 21:15

Hooray! I'm not running any Debian Buster instances anymore!

I'm only two weeks late - approximate EOL date is 2022-08-14, exactly one year since Bullseye release. Not a great timing, but not too bad for a homelab.

entry.title: Vitaly Potyarkin / 2022-07-27 07:52
entry.content:
I'm surrounded by failing hardware. UPS that "protects" my home server has a dead battery. Router at my parents' home has a dead power supply.

Such small failures are tiresome to fix. Frankly, it's cheaper and easier to toss bad device to a landfill than to fix it.

Yeah. Landfills. I'll try to remember about them next time I'm grumpy with a multimeter in hand
